content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-198-12-B
|Item_parent=Microcrystalline arthropathies
|Item_parent_short=Microcrystalline arthropathies
|Rank=B
|Intitle=Knowing polyarticular or oligoarticular forms
|Description=A known gout sufferer
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=12}}
Apart from gouty attacks, gout can give rise to the following manifestations:

- after several years, gout can affect the upper limbs and even the spine, hip and shoulder.

- oligoarthritis or gouty polyarthritis may occur.

question.question: After several years, a gout sufferer may develop arthritis in various joints. Which of the following is NOT a typical manifestation of gout progression?
question.option_b: Gout affecting the upper limbs and spine
